speaker: Outstanding Sound Mixing for a Comedy Series or Special
text: Thomas J. Huth, Andre Caporaso, Robert Douglass, Dana Mark McClure  * * *  ## Transcript {Mike Lee}    _ACT ONE  Scene One - Apartment Frasier opens the door to Roz, holding an envelope._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Roz, to what to I owe the pleasure?
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Sound Mixing for a Comedy Series or Special

speaker: Roz
text: A messenger delivered this for you after you left.  It's marked "Personal and Confidential."  I thought it might be important.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, I already tried that, forget it.  We could use some brighter bulbs at the office.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes well, a brighter bulb wouldn't have admitted it. [_opens the envelope_] Let's see - oh!  "Dear Dr. Crane, enclosed are four tickets to tonight's Sonics game as thanks for your advice on today's show.  Sincerely, Allen from Earlemont."

speaker: Roz
text: That is gonna be a great game!  You should take your dad and have a boy's night out.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually Niles and I are already having a boy's night out.  We're gonna go see the Northwest Chamber Ensemble's Spring Sing.  After that, a late dinner at Le Cigare Volant!

speaker: Roz
text: Ooh, throw in a couple of strippers and that still sounds boring.

speaker: Frasier
text: And to think I was going to offer you these basketball tickets.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, can't use 'em anyway.  I have a date with this French guy.

speaker: Frasier
text: So that's it, huh?  No Americans left.

speaker: Roz
text: That's very funny.  You know, I hope it goes well, because he doesn't speak any English, and the only French I know is

speaker: Frasier
text: I suppose you'll just be using one of those.

speaker: Roz
text: Before you get too clever, you're the one who's going out with his brother.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_can say nothing but_] Have a nice date, Roz.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Dad, I've got something here that I think you might be interested in.

speaker: Martin
text: Whoa-ho!  Sonics tickets, how about that!  Well, looks like I owe you an apology!

speaker: Frasier
text: An apology?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, last October you said we would go to a game together, but I thought that was just a lot of talk.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, listen Dad, I intended to-

speaker: Martin
text: Well, it doesn't matter how long it took.  You came through, that's what's important.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_trapped_] Glad to see you're so excited.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, who wouldn't be? [_checks the tickets_] Oh, look where we're sitting!  Oh Frasier, you're the best!

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen Dad, there's something you should know-

speaker: Frasier
text: You're paying for the snacks.

speaker: Martin
text: All right!  Well, we'd better get going!  Who are the other tickets for?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, uh, [_the doorbell rings_] they're for, uh, Niles and Daphne, of course.  But, um, I made the arrangements so long ago I didn't anticipate Daphne going for her master's degree at the Fat Academy.  [_N.B. Jane Leeves does not appear - Daphne is away at "reducing" camp._]

speaker: Frasier
text: But, uh, you know, Dad, uh, why don't I let Niles in, and then you can go get ready, all right?

speaker: Martin
text: I am ready.

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't you want to take your big foam finger?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I got some nacho cheese on it last time, it smells kind of funky.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_tries to sound cheerful_] This is gonna be fun!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh good, for a moment I'd thought you'd left.  You have the tickets?

speaker: Martin
text: Right here, we're good to go!

speaker: Niles
text: Dad's going with us?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, all three of us!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, we'd better get a move on, I'd like to get there early and see the players warm up.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, me too! [_to Frasier_] What a surprise this is!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, just you wait!  _They head out the door.  FADE OUT_  **HOOPING CRANES**  _Scene Two - Stadium The stadium is packed with roaring fans, and the game is in full swing. Frasier and Niles come down to four empty seats next to the aisle._

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, here we are, Row four.  Here look, why don't we let Dad sit between us?

speaker: Niles
text: Good idea.

speaker: Announcer
text: [_over P.A._] Now entering for the Sonics, Number Thirty-One, Brent Barry!

speaker: Niles
text: It's like those family road trips Dad used to drag us on. Uncomfortable seats, sticky floors, underlying threat of violence.

speaker: Frasier
text: However did we get through those?

speaker: Niles
text: Games, mostly.  License plate spotting, I Spy, throwing up.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Niles, that wouldn't be so much a game as an activity.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh hi, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: I sold the other ticket.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh good, what'd you get for it?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, these three frosty fellows and a chili dog that didn't make it.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_takes a beer_] Thank you.

speaker: Martin
text: [_sits in the middle seat_] Oh great, I didn't miss much.

speaker: Frasier
text: I spy, with my little eye, something beginning with "V."

speaker: Niles
text: [_looking around_] Vagabond.

speaker: Frasier
text: No.

speaker: Niles
text: Vittles.

speaker: Frasier
text: No.

speaker: Niles
text: Vienna sausages.

speaker: Frasier
text: Where do you see Vienna sausages?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I thought maybe that vendor might - oh, oh! "Vendor, vendor!"

speaker: Frasier
text: Excellent, Niles!  Your turn.

speaker: Niles
text: I spy, with my little eye-

speaker: Martin
text: Would you cut it out, I'm trying to watch the game!

speaker: Frasier
text: We're just playing I Spy, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: I know, and it's distracting.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, we used to do it all the time on family vacations.

speaker: Martin
text: And it was distracting then, so cut it out, or it'll end up like our family trip to Arizona.

speaker: Niles
text: You mean you'll turn around in your seat and almost drive the arena into the Grand Canyon?

speaker: Frasier
text: Tell you what, Dad, here. [_getting up_] Why don't you switch seats with me, and that way we won't disturb you?

speaker: Martin
text: All right, OK. _They switch, putting Martin in the aisle seat, and Frasier between him and Niles.  A heavyset woman wearing a Sonics windbreaker and baseball cap comes down with a large beer, and shuffles past them into the seat next to Niles._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, here's the lady who bought my ticket.  I see you got yourself some suds there, huh?

speaker: Fan
text: Oh, you know it!  You can't watch the Sonics without a beer or two! [_to Niles_] Especially this season, you know what I'm saying, huh?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, might I. [_to Frasier_] I spy-

speaker: Fan
text: COME ON, BEECHAM, MOVE THAT SIDE OF BEEF DOWN THERE AND PLAY SOME DE-FENSE! _Niles rears back like a man trapped in a cave with an as-yet distracted lion._

speaker: Fan
text: Come on, come on... YEAH-AAAAAHHHH! _She turns to Niles and throws up her hand for a hi-five, causing him to gasp and cringe.  He weakly slaps her hand, then turns to Frasier._

speaker: Niles
text: Switch seats with me.

speaker: Fan
text: COME ON, HUSTLE!  LET'S SEE SOME BALL MOVEMENT!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_no fool_] I'm going to say no.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, there's no way I'm enduring this for... however long this thing lasts!  Uh, Dad, Dad, I'm sorry, eh, my leg is getting a little stiff.  Would you mind switching seats with me so I can stretch it out?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, stiff leg, huh?  Must have been that bullet you had pumped into you while stopping a robbery.  Oh no, wait, that was me!

speaker: Niles
text: Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, all right, all right, but this is the last time I'm moving.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, just uh, you go in there, and I'll step through here.  _Niles and Martin get up and awkwardly shuffle past each other. Now Niles is in the aisle seat._

speaker: Niles
text: Ow, oh, my leg's very tender. [_sits down_] Oh well, better!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, my legs are much longer than yours.

speaker: Niles
text: So?

speaker: Frasier
text: So I should be sitting in that seat.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'm not switching.

speaker: Frasier
text: It was mine to begin with.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'm still not switching.  I spy, with my little eye-

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm not playing.

speaker: Niles
text: Fine.

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now what are you doing?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm staving off chapping.  It's very dry in here, and I don't have any lip balm.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_takes out a little jar_] I do. [_Niles reaches for it, but he pulls it away_] Switch seats with me.

speaker: Niles
text: My integrity is not for sale.

speaker: Frasier
text: Suit yourself. [_takes some balm and slowly applies it to his own lips_] Oh my, these rich, waxy emollients are delightfully soothing...

speaker: Niles
text: All right, you can have the seat, for goodness's sake, here!

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: Give me that. [_takes the balm and starts applying it_]

speaker: Announcer
text: Ladies and gentlemen, check your seat number!  At half-time, one lucky fan will be taking your Northwest Cable's half- court shot!  Are you ready?  If your seat is Section 101-

speaker: Announcer
text: Row 4-

speaker: Announcer
text: Seat 2, congratulations! _On the huge roof-mounted TV screen, there is a shot centered on Niles, obliviously balming his lips, framed by the flashing message, "WE GOT A SHOOTER!" As Martin slaps his back and points up towards the camera, he slowly raises his head.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Three - Stadium Niles is standing up, next to a P.R. Woman with a clipboard and a basketball jersey._

speaker: Frasier
text: Good luck, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Thanks, Frasier.

speaker: Martin
text: Praying, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Thanks, Dad.

speaker: Woman
text: Come on, right this way. [_holds up clipboard_] Now, we need you to sign this release form.

speaker: Niles
text: Why, what happened?

speaker: Woman
text: No, it's just so we can use your image on television. [_points_] Right there is fine. [_he signs it_] OK, now I need you to put this on.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, uh, OK, sure, uh, let me just- [_takes off his suit jacket_] Can I undo this?

speaker: Woman
text: Absolutely.  Are you OK? _Niles wrestles his arms and head through the jersey, a garment about as familiar to him as a brassiere._

speaker: Niles
text: [_tangled_] I just haven't done a lot of basket-balling. I'm just a bit nervous.

speaker: Woman
text: Ah, don't worry.  Nobody makes the shot.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, well I'm not even sure I can roll it that far...  _Just as Niles almost has his head through, a loud buzzer sounds, making him jump._

speaker: Niles
text: What's that?!

speaker: Woman
text: Oh, that's nothing.  It's just half-time. _He finally gets the jersey down over his head, and she leads him down to the court._

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank God we switched seats, that could be me down there! Poor Niles!

speaker: Martin
text: What do you mean?  Every guy dreams of a chance like this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dream or not, Dad, eventually he's going to try to take that shot.  You know how Niles throws!

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, and you're Pete Maravich.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know what that means.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, it means instead of criticizing him you might be a little more supportive.  Because, no matter what happens down there, he's still your brother and my son.

speaker: Martin
text: Whoops, here we go.  Hand me his beer, I'm going to need it.

speaker: Announcer
text: Ladies and gentlemen, here to attempt your Northwest Cable's half-court shot, from right here in Seattle - Niles Crane! _Applause.  The stadium lights go out, except for two spotlights: one on Niles, in the center of the court, and the other on the basket, fifty feet away.  The P.R. Woman hands him a basketball._

speaker: Woman
text: There you go, Niles.  Good luck. _She walks away.  Niles looks out at his invisible audience, and bows.  The scene goes into SLOW MOTION, and the Chicago Bulls' intro music begins to play over the soundtrack:  Niles dribbles the ball once, and it bounces back up into his hands.  He flashes a grin at the stands.  Frasier and Martin are there, cheering and holding up their thumbs.  Niles dribbles the ball again.  It bounces away, and he lurches after it.  Frasier and Martin put their hands over their eyes.  Niles gets the ball back, and tries several ready positions, holding the ball behind his hip like a shot-putter, then over his shoulder like a quarterback.  Finally, he bows over, holds the ball between his legs, looks at the basket, takes a deep breath..._ [_FULL-COURT SHOT - the camera wides to include both Niles and the basket, meaning the following cannot be faked:_] _And does a full-body, underhand heave that sends the ball in an arc towards the basket and swishing right through the string mesh.  The crowd erupts into applause.  In the stands, Martin nearly has a heart attack.  As Niles stands there stunned, the Sonics' Cheerleading Squad runs out onto the court and mobs him.  Martin and Frasier trade a look of amazement, then they rise with the rest of the crowd, cheering.  The camera revolves around Niles.  As the cheerleaders dance around him, his stupor gives way to realization, and then triumph. He raises his arms in victory, and the applause becomes thunderous.  FADE TO:  Scene Four - Apartment The Crane boys come back from the game._

speaker: Frasier
text: Now entering the apartment, a 5'9'' psychiatrist from Seattle, Niles Crane!

speaker: Martin
text: Yahoo! [_as Niles hangs up his coat_] He shakes, he bakes, he drives to the coat rack, he takes an arm out of the sleeve, he puts it up... and IT'S GOOD!

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you, Dad.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_pouring sherry_] Glass of sherry, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Please.

speaker: Martin
text: [_as Niles takes the glass_] He holds the glass, goes up to the sherry... IT'S GOOD!

speaker: Niles
text: OK, Dad!

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, Niles, you making that basket tonight was truly astonishing.  And what's even more unbelievable is that you are now the proud owner of a rugged, ram-tough, all-terrain pickup truck.

speaker: Niles
text: It occurred to me we could use it to go antiquing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah! [_clinks his glass against Niles's_]

speaker: Martin
text: [_checks the answering machine_] Whoa, fourteen messages, new record! [_presses button_]

speaker: Duke
text: [_on machine_] Hey Martin, it's Duke.  Was that Niles on Sports Center, or am I drunk?  Call me. [_beep_]

speaker: Frank
text: [_on machine_] Marty, it's Frank.  Bad news, Stosh had another heart attack... he saw your son make that basket, it's the greatest thing I've ever seen!  Uh, give me a call. [_beep_]

speaker: Stosh
text: [_on machine_] Hey Marty, it's Stosh.  Bad news-

speaker: Frank
text: I just did that one!

speaker: Stosh
text: Oh, sorry.  Make sure you catch Sports Center!  Congrats. [_beep_]

speaker: Martin
text: [_stops the tape_] We'll listen to the rest of them later. Oh Niles, I can't tell you how great you were tonight!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, thanks Dad, but I wasn't great.  I just walked out on the court and heaved the ball as hard as I could and the rest was just luck.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that may be so, Niles, but still and all you did go down and do it.  Not many people could have done that.

speaker: Martin
text: I know I always told you boys that sports aren't important... but they are!  And what you did tonight out there makes me really proud.

speaker: Niles
text: Thanks.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good thing I wangled those tickets, eh, Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: [_looks at the TV_] Oh look, Niles is on TV!  Oh, I can't believe it, he made Player of the Week!  We've got us a real-life celebrity in our own home! [_watching the replay_] It's up... and IT'S GOOD!  _Niles raises his arms in another victory gesture while Frasier continues to stew.  FADE TO:_  **FRENCH KISS-OFF**  _Scene Five - Caf e Nervosa Frasier is sitting at a table.  Niles comes in wearing a Sonics letterman jacket._

speaker: Niles
text: [_to counter person_] Excuse me, nonfat latte to go, please. Hey Frasier, mind if I join you? _By now, Frasier is in familiar sibling-rivalry mode.  He slowly lowers his newspaper, looks at Niles over the top of it, and purses his lips at his jacket._

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you sure?  The jocks usually sit over at that table.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, this thing, yes, well, this was just part of a gift package the Sonics sent over.  _Before he sits down, he makes sure to turn around, showing "CRANE" stenciled on the back._

speaker: Niles
text: I just didn't want to seem ungrateful.  Not that I owe them anything; after all, I'm the one that drained it from way downtown.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, so we've been hearing.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh Frasier, don't grouse.  I've earmarked a pair of practice pants for you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Niles, but I'd like to think I've already mastered pants.  I assume you're going to select a more appropriate jacket for this evening's concert?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh yeah, about that - Dad wants me to go with him to McGinty's so he can have me tell the tale.

speaker: Frasier
text: But Niles, we've already rescheduled the concert once!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, that was because of you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, not because of me, it was because of Dad.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, so is McGinty's.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's not the same!  We had an agreement!  If you should choose to dishonor it, there will be consequences.

speaker: Niles
text: Why don't we compromise?

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmm?

speaker: Niles
text: Let's say we go and have a drink with Dad at McGinty's, and then afterwards proceed along to the concert?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_fumbling_] Well, I just don't, I don't, uh, well, I - all right, fine.

speaker: Niles
text: I'll see you later, Frasier.

speaker: Roz
text: Wow, Niles!  You finally made varsity after thirty years, huh?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, but it's not a real varsity jacket, Roz, so you're under no obligation to sleep with me.

speaker: Roz
text: See you around.

speaker: Niles
text: Take care.

speaker: Roz
text: Hi, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: You may join me if you wish, Roz.  Be forewarned, I am feeling a bit peevish.

speaker: Roz
text: [_sitting_] Oh, for God's sake, you're like Goldilocks with that latte.  "This foam is too hard, this foam is too soft"-

speaker: Frasier
text: No, this is not about latte foam, Roz!  Ever since Niles made that basket, his head's been getting bigger and bigger.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, you have to admit it was pretty amazing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Amazingly lucky!  To hear Niles tell it, it all started with a little rubber factory in Sumatra, where an unsuspecting basketball began a journey that would lead to greatness.

speaker: Roz
text: So he's milking it a little bit, you'd do the same thing!

speaker: Frasier
text: I would not!  I would treat it as the chance occurrence it was... like finding a terrific parking spot in front of the opera house.

speaker: Roz
text: [_pouncing_] You bragged about that for weeks!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it was right in front of the steps, Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: You know what I mean, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I suppose I do.  Guess I'll just have to grin and bear it for a little while longer.

speaker: Roz
text: [_gasps_] There's Jean-Pierre.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, your French beau.  How's that going?

speaker: Roz
text: I'm breaking up with him.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm sorry.

speaker: Roz
text: Actually, you're going to do it for me.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?!

speaker: Roz
text: I don't speak French!  I need you to translate-

speaker: Frasier
text: For God's sake-

speaker: Roz
text: Pleeease?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, all right!

speaker: Roz
text: [_cups a hand and yells in his ear_] We're having coffee! Sit down!

speaker: Frasier
text: I can't imagine why this isn't working. _Jean-Pierre sits at their table.  The substance of his and Frasier's conversation appear in English subtitles at the bottom of the screen.  Update 2010/8/8: Thanks to William Melvin for transcribing the French conversation between Frasier and Jean-Pierre and also providing a literal translation, which differs from the subtitles._

speaker: Roz
text: Jean-Pierre, this is Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shaking hands_] Uh, C'est un plaisir de faire votre connaissance. [subtitle: It's a pleasure to meet you.] [literal: It's a pleasure to make your acquaintance.]

speaker: Roz
text: Now I want to do this gently, so will you tell him that I think he's a really nice guy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh-huh. Roz trouve que vous etes genial. [subtitle: Roz thinks you're a great guy.] [literal: Roz thinks that you're fantastic.]

speaker: Jean-Pierre
text: Elle veut rompre avec moi, n'est-ce pas? [subtitle: She wants to break up with me, doesn't she?] [literal: She wants to break up with me, is that it?]_Frasier shrugs and nods._

speaker: Jean-Pierre
text: Tant mieux! Elle n'est pas mon type. Ça fait quelque temps que je cherche a m'en debarrasser. [subtitle: Thank God, she's not my type.  I've been looking for a way out for days.] [literal: All the better! She's not my type. It's been a while that I've been trying to get out of it.]

speaker: Roz
text: What'd he say?

speaker: Frasier
text: Um, he said that he-he's very fond of you too.

speaker: Roz
text: OK, now tell him that these past few weeks... have been really fun.

speaker: Frasier
text: You can go faster, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Let me do this my way.  Tell him!

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, Voyez… elle a tout arrange. Si ça ne vous derange pas de la laisser faire.****             [subtitle: Look… she's got all this worked out, if you don't mind indulging her.] [literal: Look… she's worked it all out. If it doesn't bother you to let her do it.]

speaker: Jean-Pierre
text: Je comprends. Dites-moi, ou peut-on manger un bon bifteck?****[subtitle: I understand.  Listen, where's a good place to get a steak?] [literal: I understand.  Tell me, where can you eat a good steak?]

speaker: Frasier
text: He says, what are you trying to say?

speaker: Roz
text: OK.  Tell him, in another time, in another place, we might have a shot, but this just isn't working for me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Les «Cinq Couronnes» sont excellent pour filet - la carte des vins n'est pas mal non plus. [subtitle: The Five Crowns has a great filet, and the wine list isn't bad either.] [literal: The "Five Crowns" are excellent for their filet - the wine list isn't bad either.]_He looks at Roz._

speaker: Frasier
text: Faire semblant de triste. [subtitle: OK, look sad.] [literal: Try to look sad.]

speaker: Jean-Pierre
text: [_sadly_] Est-ce qu'on peut fumer au restaurant? [subtitle: Can you smoke in there?] [literal: Can you smoke in the restaurant?]

speaker: Frasier
text: Is there any chance you'd reconsider?

speaker: Roz
text: I don't think so.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh. Vous pouvez fumer dans le patio. [subtitle: You can smoke on the patio.] [literal: You can smoke in the patio area.]

speaker: Roz
text: Is he OK?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes Roz, he'll be fine.  But, you know, I think for his sake we should wrap this up. [_they get up_]

speaker: Roz
text: Jean-Pierre...

speaker: Jean-Pierre
text: Roz...

speaker: Jean-Pierre
text: [_over her shoulder, to Frasier_] Merci pour le conseil, je meurs de faim! [subtitle: Thanks for the tip. God, I'm starving!] [literal: Thanks for the advice, I'm dying of hunger!]

speaker: Frasier
text: He says that he'll-

speaker: Roz
text: Please, Frasier.  Some things don't need to be translated.  _She kisses Jean-Pierre.  They exchange a faraway look, and Jean-Pierre leaves.  FADE TO:  Scene Six - McGinty's Niles and Martin are seated at the bar, surrounded by appreciative barflies.  They are watching a video of Niles's shot.  Frasier sits behind Niles, writhing in envy._

speaker: Bartender
text: So at this point, what were you thinking?

speaker: Niles
text: Stop tape, please. [_the bartender does_]

speaker: Martin
text: Boy, I'd be thinking about that sweet truck.

speaker: Barfly
text: Yeah, me, too.

speaker: Niles
text: [_chuckles_] Not me.  If you're focusing on the reward, that's energy you're not using to make the shot.

speaker: Martin
text: And you know what else?  He's donating that truck to the Police Activities League!

speaker: Niles
text: I just want the kids to know it's about the play-offs, not the pay-offs.

speaker: Martin
text: Is this a great boy, or what?  You sure I can't pay you for this beer?

speaker: Bartender
text: Hey, your money's no good here.  "Half-Court" Crane's dad doesn't pay for drinks.

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me, Niles, but we have a concert to make.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I know, soon, soon.  I can't leave the fellas hanging, Frasier.  Ah, back to the tape.  Now, that's about forty- five feet to that basket.  You see, I used my whole body, form is everything.  You've already made or missed the shot even before you release the ball.  And of course, we all know the rest of the story.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_can take no more_] Yes, yes!  The story is, "once upon a time, Niles Crane accidentally made a basket, The End!"

speaker: Niles
text: I don't deny there was some luck involved, but as we all know, luck is the residue of design.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, please!  Somehow managing to hurl a ball forward is hardly design!

speaker: Niles
text: You're just jealous because I have game and you don't.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, please!  So you think you have game?

speaker: Niles
text: I do, yea.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh-

speaker: Bartender
text: [_to Martin_] Think they're gonna fight?

speaker: Martin
text: [_wearily_] I got news for you, they are fighting.

speaker: Frasier
text: We'll just see about that!  Barkeep!

speaker: Martin
text: What are you doing?  _Frasier puts a twenty-dollar bill on the bar and points to the Mini-Hoop machine in the corner._

speaker: Frasier
text: I am going to challenge Niles to a game of One-on-One on that contraption over there.

speaker: Martin
text: [_alarmed_] What do you want to do that for?!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to bartender_] Twenty dollars of your cleanest quarters!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, whoa, what about your concert, you guys better get moving, tick-tock!

speaker: Niles
text: All right, Frasier, game on! _Frasier gets his change.  As they head over to the machine, the barflies all watch with anticipation - except Martin, who knows all too well what's going to happen._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh wait, it's not worth it!  Sports aren't everything!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, hotshot, after you. [_Niles takes the ball_]

speaker: Bartender
text: Let's go, Half-Court!  Put it up, baby! [_the barflies cheer_]

speaker: Niles
text: Thank-thank you, I appreciate the support, but I think I might throw better with fewer voices. _The barflies fall into a reverent silence.  While Frasier stands next to the machine, Niles faces the basket, cocks his arm... and awkwardly jerks the ball forward, missing the machine's cage entirely and bouncing the ball off Frasier._

speaker: Niles
text: Well, obviously I'm accustomed to shooting from further back.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and just once!  Allow me. _Frasier takes the ball, stands in front of the cage, aims... and throws just as awkwardly, missing the basket.  Martin puts a hand over his face._

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, your turn.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, I believe I'm warmed up now. _He takes the ball again, and raises his leg to rest it on the front of the machine.  He throws the ball and stumbles to the floor._

speaker: Niles
text: Wait, yeah, I hit the round part, and that's worth, uh, a half a point!

speaker: Martin
text: I think I could use another beer.

speaker: Bartender
text: That'll be $2.95.  _Martin looks devastated.  He glares towards the boys as he angrily yanks his wallet from his pocket.  END OF ACT TWO_

speaker: INSERT
text: _We see a series of abortive takes of Scene Three, revealing that it actually took David Hyde Pierce twenty-seven tries to make the basket.  The shot was filmed on location at Los Angeles's Staples Center on January 9th, 2001._
